    This is an INFORMATION bcls-aside (<aside class="bcls-aside bcls-aside--information">) - it's not best practices or a warning, just information about the concept that you want to call out. Any of the bcls-aside types can be used anywhere - tables, lists, whatever. Note: is automatically included at the beginning, so you don't need to include that in your text.
    This is a TIP bcls-aside (<aside class="bcls-aside bcls-aside--tip">) - it's about best practices or something like that. Tip: is automatically included at the beginning, so you don't need to include that in your text.
    This is a WARNING bcls-aside (<aside class="bcls-aside bcls-aside--warning">) - it's a warning about a gotcha or a limitation. Warning: is automatically included at the beginning, so you don't need to include that in your text.

    Notice that you can embed other HTML elements of any kind in an bcls-aside.

    • Like lists
    • For example
